wikipedia_page.main: Sir Arthur James Herbert,  (22 August 1855 – 31 August 1921) was a British diplomat who served as the first British envoy to Norway.

link_mentions.page: List of diplomats of the United Kingdom to Norway
response: The Ambassador of the United Kingdom to Norway is the United Kingdom's foremost diplomatic representative in Norway, and head of the UK's diplomatic mission in Norway.  The official title is Her Britannic Majesty's Ambassador to the Kingdom of Norway. Norway and the United Kingdom have exchanged diplomats since Norway became independent, when Sir Arthur Herbert was appointed British Minister to Norway on 27 October 1905.

Sir John Arthur Herbert GCIE (16 December 1895 – 11 December 1943) was a Conservative Party politician in the United Kingdom and a colonial governor in British India, serving as Governor of Bengal from 1939 till his death in December 1943.

Sir John died at Government House, Calcutta on 11 December 1943.Geneanet - Colonel, Sir John Arthur Herbert G.C.I.E. Following his death, his widow served as a Woman of the Bedchamber to Princess Elizabeth from 1944 until her death in 1948.

His mother was the Honourable Augusta Charlotte Elizabeth Hall, the only surviving daughter and sole heiress of Benjamin Hall, 1st Baron Llanover and his wife Augusta Waddington, better known as the Welsh cultural nationalist Lady Llanover, heiress of the considerable Llanover estate in Monmouthshire.Leo van der Pas. "Descendants of Mary Tudor, Princess of England (gen 14-475 to 14-504 of 19 generations)" on www.worldroots.com. Retrieved 10 August 2007. Augusta Hall (1802-1896) biography available in English He had two younger brothers, Edward Bleiddyn and Arthur (whose descendants still own Llanover today).Sir Arthur James Herbert, of the Diplomatic Service, was first British ambassador to Oslo, Norway, and owned Coldbrook, in Abergavenny, and he or more likely, his son inherited Llanover at some point (). His son was Colonel Sir John Arthur Herbert, of Llanover, GCIE(1895-11 December] 1943) and was Governor-General of Bengal till that year. He married in 1924 a daughter of the 6th Earl of Ilchester and had issue (; Clarence 8). The names of the three brothers are available with their professions in 1896 in an article about their grandmother's death.. Retrieved 10 August 2007
*Arthur Herbert, 1st Earl of Torrington (c.1648–1716), British admiral and politician
